page.title: 03HOUSING IN BLACKBURN (2)
page.content: 407 Bolton Road is a typical late Victorian terraced house bordering a main road. It is constructed of brick, with stone dressings to the front and has a slate roof. There is a small front garden and a flagged rear yard with a brick built outbuilding, originally an outside toilet. On the ground floor there are three rooms, a lounge, a living room and a kitchen. The lounge is 10'7" by 12'6", the living room is 11'3" by 14'4", both rooms are heated by gas. On the first floor there are 2 bedrooms and a bathroom. The front bedroom measures 14'1" by 12'8", the rear bedroom is smaller and contains an electric immersion water heater. The bathroom has a bath, toilet and wash basin. In June 1985 the value of this house was Â£11950.
